alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 8:22AM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 in the lower elevations and 2 to 3 feet over Marias Pass and in the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Marias Pass, Essex, Bad Rock Canyon, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, and Polebridge. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Arctic front to bring a rapid temperature drop and gusty northeast winds and dangerous wind chills beginning Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
